availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, grocer. Kentucky native. Married to Latitia Randall. Father of John Randall, Susan Randall, Sarah Randall, and Thomas Randall. Owned four enslaved persons in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850. Grocer in Lexington in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Ward 3, Lexington, p. 150.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette, District 2.
Find A Grave, "Thomas G. Randall (January 19, 1814-December 3, 1880)," Memorial #98027549, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/98027549 (accessed April 12, 2018).
